page.title: 01The Corrie coast and Hills
page.content: The village of corrie is linear, lying along the coast road. In the village is a sub-post ofice, a shop and two craft shops. There is also the Corrie Hotel ad many smaller guest houses. Behind the village are many disused limestone quarries - cut into the hillside. There is a primary school in the village, but the nearest high school is in Lamlash. Above corie is a area of coniferous plantations - owned by the forestry commission. One of the main physical features of the area is The Devil's Punchbowl - a steep sided Corie in the side of Cioch Na H'oighe. The hills behind Corie are very popular with hillwalkers, and they provide many different routes to the summit of Goatfell. The south-west corner of this area is owned by the National Trust for Scotland; part of the area is a site
